item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley Details Trick or Treat 2025 Event
item.description:
Gameloft has announced that Disney Dreamlight Valley 's annual Trick or Treat event will begin on October 15 and run through October 31, giving players about two weeks to participate in the limited-time event and collect some spooky rewards. Disney Dreamlight Valley was originally released in early access on September 6, 2022, and is currently available on PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, and Nintendo Switch.

While the upcoming Trick or Treat event is sure to delight many fans, a lot of players are eagerly awaiting new information about the upcoming Wishblossom Ranch DLC for Disney Dreamlight Valley . From what has been shared, gamers will soon be able to fight off The Decay in order to restore the ranch to working order. Fans will also be able to interact with free-roaming horses, a new mechanic that is sure to add even more life to the bustling setting. Players will be able to learn even more about the upcoming paid DLC during a special presentation scheduled to take place on October 15.

Disney Dreamlight Valley’s Trick or Treat Event Offers Free Rewards

Gameloft has also announced that it will be kicking off its annual Halloween celebration in Disney Dreamlight Valley on October 15. The event will run through the rest of October, giving players plenty of time to collect candy and claim rewards. While longtime players may recognize some returning elements from Disney Dreamlight Valley 's previous Trick or Treat events, they can expect to see some fresh content as well.

Trick or Treat 2025 Rewards

  • NEW : Haunted Well – complete the Haunted Well puzzle.
  • Happy Jack-O'-Lantern – complete the Sugar Rush achievement.
  • Mischievous Jack-O'-Lantern – complete the Sugar Rush achievement.
  • Friendly Jack-O'-Lantern – complete the Sugar Rush achievement.
  • Mickey Mouse Pumpkin – complete the Trick or Treat achievement.
  • Pumpkin Stack – complete the Stockpiling Pumpkins achievement.
  • Green Trick-or-Treater's Bounty – complete the A 3-Course Halloween Meal achievement.
  • Purple Trick-or-Treater's Bounty – complete the Villainy Wears Many Masks achievement.

In order to participate, players will want to start collecting candy from Candy Bowls in Disney Dreamlight Valley . Candy Bowls can be red, purple, or green, with each one rewarding players with two pieces of candy. From October 15 through October 30, two Candy Bowls of each color will appear every 24 hours. However, on October 31, these Candy Bowls will appear every hour. Once collected, the candy can be used to complete Event Duties. A new Haunted Well will also be featured within the world, though players will need to make sure that they have unlocked the Forest of Valor to take advantage of this new content.

Xbox Game Pass Core recently added Disney Dreamlight Valley to its catalog of available titles on October 1, which means players with a subscription can jump into the game and try out the Trick or Treat event at no additional cost. With so much content to enjoy and even more on the way, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Disney Dreamlight Valley .

item.title: Best Kord 6P67 Loadout in Battlefield 6
item.description:
The AEK-971 returns in Battlefield 6 as the Kord 6P67, a rapid-fire assault rifle with low recoil and high lethality. If you've played the previous Battlefield games, you should already know what to expect from rifle, but if you're a new player who loves fighting in close quarters, then you're in for a wonderful time.

The Kord is an absolute bullethose of a gun, but even though it shoots at an extreme rate, it is still very easy to control, and it's surprisingly accurate too. This Kord build for Battlefield 6 is built to play around the rifle's strengths and help players get more out of it in both close and long-ranged fights.

How to Use The Kord in Battlefield 6

Damage

20

Rate of Fire

900

Magazine

30

Hipfire

46

Precision

41

Control

59

Mobility

46

ADS Speed

300

Reload Time

2.16

Muzzle Velocity

760

Headshot Multiplier

1.34x

The Kord has already gained a reputation for being the best assault rifle in the game. It is very similar to the M4A1 in BF6 — both have the same fire rate, though the Kord has a damage value of 20, which means the fastest it can kill an enemy is in five shots to the chest or four to the head . Both the Kord and M4A1 remain effective at ~100m, where they can down the Firing Range target at that range with six body shots.

Recoil is almost a non-issue with the Kord. You'll have very little trouble controlling the upward climb of its muzzle when firing in full auto, though you will have to deal with horizontal recoil. The Kord moves to the left when you're shooting, so keep that in mind when you're trying to make accurate shots from a distance.

Also, the Kord is one of the few guns in the game that has a burst fire mode. It fires two shots in very rapid succession, making it incredible for long-range shooting.

Best Kord Build in Battlefield 6

Muzzle

Linear Comp

Foregrip

[Situational]

Barrel

Heavy

Magazine

30-round Fast Mag

Ammo

Basic

Ergonomics

None

Sight

Preferred optic

Accessories

5mw Red Laser (optional)

Since the Kord likes to veer to the left during full-auto shooting, the Linear Comp is going to be our muzzle device of choice. It tones down horizontal recoil in exchange for a stronger vertical kick, but since the Kord's vertical recoil is already low, this downside isn't all that bad, especially since we'll also be using a foregrip attachment.

Speaking of foregrips, even the ones that offer the lowest level of recoil reduction do a great job at stabilizing the Kord. Because of this, we recommend basing your choice on your preferred engagement distance or the map you're playing on:

  • Alloy Vertical and Ribbed Stubby Grips have no drawbacks, making them good for close-medium-ranged engagements.
  • Classic Vertical and Low-Profile Stubby Grips greatly decrease your recoil, making them good if you want to use magnified optics.
  • Bipod and Grip Pods are also good when you're using magnified optics.

The rest of the attachments are up to taste. If you're playing with a magnified optic, consider bringing a canted sight for close quarters. We recommend keeping an eye on your ADS speed, as that's likely going to be the stat that determines if you win close-range duels.

item.title: Pokemon Leak Reveals When to Expect the Generation 11 Games
item.description:
A recent leak indicates that the 11th generation of Pokemon games may be coming in 2030. It may be a while before gamers can finally play Gen 11 Pokemon games, but fans should not worry, as the recent leaks also address Gen 10, which will obviously be available much earlier.

A major Pokemon leak has recently given fans access to some details about the franchise’s future. The most interesting announcement of the leak is that Gen 10 Pokemon games will allegedly be called Pokemon Winds and Waves , and that these titles will be set in a region based on Southeast Asia and Indonesia. They will also feature “infinity” as their main theme, and will be Switch 2 exclusives, according to the leak.

Gen 11 Pokemon Games Could Be Out in 2030

Another interesting detail of the leak was recently shared by Centro Leaks: Gen 11 Pokemon games will only come out in 2030, if Nintendo’s plans run smoothly. This is not surprising when considering the releases of previous Pokemon games. Gen 8’s Pokemon Sword and Shield were released in 2019, while Gen 9’s Scarlet and Violet were available in late 2022. Following similar development times, Gen 10 could be launched in 2026, followed by another game four years later.

Fans should not be bummed out that it may take half a decade for Gen 11 to be ready for launch, though, as Pokemon ’s Gen 10 seems to be just around the corner. Some previous leaks have indicated that Pokemon Wind and Waves will be properly revealed at Pokemon Day in February 2026, with a release date for later in the same year or possibly 2027 at the latest.

Another interesting detail about Gen 10 Pokemon games is that they could feature “infinite” islands, according to these leaks. Apart from procedurally generated islands, it’s rumored that the basic Pokemon in these games will have “infinite variations” when evolving, which could lead to some major changes in the franchise. It’s not known, however, how much of the game’s world will be procedurally generated, and, obviously, these rumors may come from credible sources, but it’s always best to take them with a grain of salt.

In any case, gamers still have plenty of Pokemon games to be occupied with while they wait for Gen 10 and 11. Pokemon Legends: Z-A is set to release on October 16, feature Mega Evolutions, and be set Lumiose City in the Kalos region. Unlike the mainline games in the series, Pokemon Legends: Z-A will feature real-time battles.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: How to Get & Fly Planes (Jets & Helicopters) in Battlefield 6
item.description:
Air vehicles are a core part of the gameplay experience when playing on the larger maps of Battlefield 6 . They are extremely powerful in the right hands, and a good pilot can single-handedly turn the tide of the match if they can hit all the right targets. However, flying planes and helicopters takes skill, and to further complicate things, there aren't many of these vehicles to go around.

As with all things, practice makes perfect, but learning how to fly a plane in Battlefield 6 is hard when your team's only jet is always occupied by someone else. In this guide, we'll be showing you where you can practice your flying skills as well as some tips on how to be a better pilot.

How to Practice Flying in Battlefield 6

As of writing, the best place to practice air vehicles is through Battlefield 6 Portal . There are already many different player-made experiences that are all about learning how to fly.

To start, go to the Community tab from the main menu, then select the Browse Servers button. You'll then be sent to a screen showing all the servers available in your region. Look around if there are any air vehicle training lobbies available, then join one of them.

If you'd much rather practice solo, you can host a Portal Experience yourself . Find an air vehicle practice server from the server browser, then press the View Server Info button shown on the right side of the screen, under the Experience's description. Scroll down the info window, then select Host/Host Locally.

Verified servers typically host official game modes with altered rules. These cannot be hosted locally, but they'll give you full XP like a normal game would. On the other hand, Custom game modes can be hosted locally, letting you bypass the dreaded Global Game Quota Exceeded Error in BF6. However, you won't get XP here the same way you would in Verified Portal modes.

Here are a few Portal Experience codes you can try for practicing/testing air vehicles:

  • DXS4 : Vehicle and Soldier Shooting Range by AP_Atipoya
  • 6GVY : Helicopter and Jets Practice by Tricky
  • X8XB : Ace Pursuit by Battlefield Official

To use these codes, go to Search Experiences, then type them into the Experience Code text bar on the left side of the screen.

How to Get Jets & Helis in Battlefield 6

If you're playing the regular BF6 game modes, you can enter a chopper or jet directly from the spawn screen by clicking on their respective icons at your team's base. Vehicle limits vary depending on the game mode and map, and if you really want to play with air vehicles, we recommend playing Escalation on Operation Firestorm or Mirak Valley .

Firestorm and Mirak Valley have large play spaces, and they feature both jets and helicopters. Once the round progresses enough, your team will get access to both vehicle types.

At the start of every match, players will instead have to physically run up to a nearby air vehicle and enter it from there (in most cases).

Piloting Tips

  • Go to Settings—>Gameplay—>Vehicles, then turn on Helicopter Control Assists . This will make it so your helicopter automatically hovers when no control input is detected.
  • If you're playing on mouse and keyboard, consider rebinding your jet controls . Binding Yaw to horizontal mouse movement may help you line your shots up when going for a strafing run.
  • Use Free Look to scope out targets .
  • Always pay attention to the map . Before you go in for a strafing run, you should already know where your targets are.
  • Focus enemy aircraft and anti-air vehicles first . Make sure to hunt them down before going for more vulnerable targets.
  • When piloting a jet, know your ideal speed values for faster turning.
  • Anti-air missiles have infinite vertical lock-on range. If you're trying to escape a lock, move horizontally away from the enemy instead.
Battlefield 6
9 /10

item.title: What Does the Cat Do in No, I'm Not a Human?
item.description:
It's almost impossible to trust anyone in No, I'm Not a Human . If the Guest who tries to enter your house isn't a Visitor, then they're probably still not a nice person, which is why it's important now more than ever to have a furry friend. Players can get their hands on a feline companion in No, I'm Not a Human , providing them with a Cat that does far more than simply look cute. Players are going to want to check out the guide below to see how to get the Cat in No, I'm Not a Human , and to see what it actually does that makes it so important to have.

How to Get the Cat in No, I'm Not a Human

In order to get the Cat in No, I'm Not a Human , you will need to let the Cat Lady (Ballerina) into your home, who appears at the door on Day 4. It's fairly obvious that the Cat Lady is not human, but you need to let her in if you want to get the Cat. The Cat Lady is ALWAYS a Visitor , so once you've invited her into your house, you should either give her a FEMA Notice or use your gun to kill her so that she doesn't add to the selection of Visitors that make it into your home.

Visitors will only begin killing your Guests if there are 2 or more Visitors in the house, so make sure you know all Visitors in No, I'm Not a Human (guide here) before letting her in and getting your human allies killed. Either way, you should let the Cat Lady inside and then kill her in the morning.

The Cat Lady will not enter the house if players have the Nun present, so you will be forced to kick out the Nun to have the Cat.

What Does the Cat Do in No, I'm Not a Human?

The Cat isn't just a cute pet that you can pet and carry around, as although those actions are cute, they serve no purpose in No, I'm Not a Human . However, the Cat does have an extremely useful mechanic. If you feed Cat Food to the Cat, then it will prevent Visitors from killing Guests in the night. Every 3 days, you can use the phone and dial 007890 to order two cans of Cat Food. You will then receive Cat Food from the ForRest deliveryman at night, then simply approach the Cat and feed it the Cat Food to see it ward off death. This buff only lasts the night that you feed the Cat the Cat Food, so be sure to feed the Cat again if you are nervous about Visitors killing your Guests. The Cat cannot detect Visitors or be used for anything other than preventing death.

Having the Cat also allows you to open the Basement, which is found under the rug of the hallway. The Basement is necessary to unlock 2 secret endings: Embrace the Inevitable and Shroom or Doom. The Cat itself is not important to the ending, but is simply a requirement to access it.

No, I'm not a Human
